required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of ARO-AAT in Patients With Alpha-1 Antitrypsin Deficiency Associated Liver Disease (AATD)
clinical_study.official_title: A Pilot Open Label, Multi-dose, Phase 2 Study to Assess the Safety and Efficacy of ARO-AAT in Patients With Alpha-1 Antitrypsin Deficiency Associated Liver Disease (AATD)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the the safety and efficacy of ARO-AAT Injection (also referred to as ARO-AAT) administered subcutaneously to patients with alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency.

detailed_description.textblock: Participants will be enrolled to receive multiple subcutaneous injections of ARO-AAT. All eligible participants will require a pre-dose biopsy completed as part of the study within the screening window. All participants will undergo an End of Study (EOS) biopsy. Treated participants will be offered the opportunity to continue treatment in an open label extension during which they will undergo a final biopsy.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline Over Time in Total, Soluble, and Insoluble Z-Alpha 1 Antitrypsin (Z-AAT) Liver Concentrations
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Week 24 (Cohort 1 &1b) or Week 48 (Cohort 2); Extension Cohort: Extension Week 44

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline Over Time in Circulating Levels of Z-AAT
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through Week 24 (Cohort 1 & 1b) or through Week 48 (Cohort 2); Extension Cohort: Baseline through Extension Weeks 44 and 92

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline Over Time in Alanine Transaminase (ALT)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through Week 24 (Cohort 1 & 1b) or Week 48 (Cohort 2); Extension Cohort: Baseline through Extension Weeks 44 and 92

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline Over Time in Gamma-Glutamyl Transferase (GGT)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Week 24 (Cohort 1 & 1b) or Week 48 (Cohort 2); Extension Cohort: Baseline and Extension Weeks 44 and 92

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline Over Time in Fibrosis-4 Index (FIB4)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through Week 24 (Cohort 1 & 1b) or Week 48 (Cohort 2); Extension Cohort: Baseline through Extension Weeks 44 and 92

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline Over Time in Aspartate Transaminase (AST) to Platelet Ratio Index (APRI)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through Week 24 (Cohort 1 & 1b) or Week 48 (Cohort 2); Extension Cohort: Baseline through Extension Weeks 44 and 92

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline Over Time in Plasma Collagen Type 3 (PRO-C3)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through Week 24 (Cohort 1 & 1b) or Week 48 (Cohort 2); Extension Cohort: Baseline through Extension Weeks 44 and 92

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline Over Time in Hepatic Stiffness based on FibroScan (when available)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Week 24 (Cohort 1 & 1b) or Week 48 (Cohort 2); Extension Cohort: Baseline and Extension Weeks 44 and 92

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline Over Time in Histological Metrics of Liver Disease: Inflammation Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Week 24 (Cohort 1 &1b) or Week 48 (Cohort 2); Extension Cohort: Extension Week 44
secondary_outcome.description: Change in inflammation score, based on pathology slide reads. Inflammation was assessed on a scale of 0-3, with higher scores showing more severe inflammation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline Over Time in Histological Metrics of Liver Disease: Steatosis Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Week 24 (Cohort 1 &1b) or Week 48 (Cohort 2); Extension Cohort: Extension Week 44
secondary_outcome.description: Change in steatosis score, based on pathology slide reads. Steatosis was assessed on a scale of 0-3, with higher scores showing more severe steatosis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline Over Time in Histological Metrics of Liver Disease: Hepatocyte Cell Death Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Week 24 (Cohort 1 &1b) or Week 48 (Cohort 2); Extension Cohort: Extension Week 44
secondary_outcome.description: Change in hepatocyte cell death score, based on pathology slide reads. Hepatocyte cell death was assessed on a scale of 0-2, with higher scores showing more severe hepatocyte cell death.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline Over Time in Meta-analysis of Histological Data in Viral Hepatitis (METAVIR) Fibrosis Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Week 24 (Cohort 1 & 1b) or Week 48 (Cohort 2); Extension Cohort: Extension Week 44
secondary_outcome.description: METAVIR scores range from F0 to F4 (F0=No Fibrosis, F1=Mild Fibrosis, F2= Significant Fibrosis, F3=Severe Fibrosis, F4=Cirrhosis). Higher scores indicate more severe fibrosis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Adverse Events (AEs) Possibly or Probably Related to Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Week 24 (Cohort 1 & 1b) or Week 48 (Cohort 2); Extension Cohort: up to Extension Week 44

arm_group.description: Administered on Day 1, Weeks 4 and 16 for a minimum of 3 doses. Treatment Extension (optional enrollment): Administered every 12 weeks for 8 additional doses.
Administered on Day 1, Weeks 4 and 16, for a minimum of 3 doses. Treatment Extension (optional enrollment): Administered every 12 weeks for 8 additional doses.
Administered on Day 1, Weeks 4, 16, 28 and 40 for a minimum of 5 doses. Treatment Extension (optional enrollment): Administered every 12 weeks for 8 additional doses.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of AATD
- Women of childbearing potential must have a negative pregnancy test, cannot be breast feeding, and must be willing to use contraception
- Willing to provide written informed consent and to comply with study requirements
- Non-smoker for at least 1 year
- No abnormal finding of clinical relevance at screening
Exclusion Criteria:
- Clinically significant health concerns other than AATD
- Previous diagnosis or diagnosis at Screening of definitive liver cirrhosis
- Regular use of alcohol within one month prior to Screening
- Use of an investigational agent or device within 30 days prior to dosing or current participation in an investigational study involving therapeutic intervention
- Use of illicit drugs within 1 year prior to Screening
Note: additional inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply, per protocol

facility.name: Medical University of Vienna Division of Gastroenterology and Hepatology
Addenbrooke's Hospital, Cambridge University Hospitals NHS Trust
Royal Infirmary of Edinburgh, NHS Lothian
